2880/A0/04/400/413.status_value: 60% of the target schools implement the child protection policy and procedure
2880/A0/04/400/413.indicator_name: Proportion of schools in the focus areas implementing the child protection policy and procedure
Increased number of schools that introduce and implement the Child Protection Policy and Procedures in education settings.

Increased number of communities with functional MDTs that address child protection concerns in coordinated manner (education  health  social welfare  justice  counseling and police)   Strengthened partnership with civil society  academia and religious communities    Increased number of  hotline operators  trained to receive and respond to the calls  so to create an infrastructure to meet the protection right of the child
Increased number of trained professionals to apply social model and community-based child protection approach in work with CWD

2880/A0/04/400/413.status_value: Over 100 social workers and staff were provided guidance on implementing the policy and procedure. representatives from 12 schools in Khovsgol and Nalaikh trained on child protection system and its elements in schools  177 dormitory teachers from 6 provinces were trained for provision of better care and protection for children

2880/A0/04/100/103.indicator_name: Percentage of  equity-focused analysis in Government M&E and research plans
2880/A0/04/100/103.headline: The capacity of statistics authorities to design instruments for collection and reporting on child rights and equitable outcomes increased throughout the year and UNICEF support led to the creation of official methodological guidelines and adoption of new tools and indicators for data collection and reporting.

2880/A0/04/100/103.status_value: Partial. The Parliament and the Government both have data  studies and analysis plan.  In 2013  1 out of 58 studies by the Parliament focuses the outcome level result. The Economic Development Ministry (major development planning institution) planned 14 out of which none has focus on the development results.  Thus  the results focused analysis and planning/programming needs to be further addressed. Moreover  more strategic selective and efficient approach needs to be designed.
2880/A0/04/100/103.indicator_name: Data and analysis plan of the Government is systematically updated
2880/A0/04/100/103.headline: The capacity of statistics authorities to design instruments for collection and reporting on child rights and equitable outcomes increased throughout the year and UNICEF support led to the creation of official methodological guidelines and adoption of new tools and indicators for data collection and reporting.

2880/A0/04/100/103.status_value: All the IMEP activities apply internationally recognized standards for the research. However  the disaggregation needs to be improved focusing migration status  registration status and others. All the planned IMEP activities have started the process of the implementation.

2880/A0/05/200/203.indicator_name: Percentage of adolescents in GFAs  reached by school and out of school programmes aimed at building adolescents skills for life
2880/A0/05/200/203.headline: UNICEF made progress in building government capacity through organization of first ever Hackathon on adolescent health issues  development of health education curriculum on mental health  gender  SRH and contributed to improved regulation on child development by finalization of National Programs on Child Development and Protection and on Non-Communicable Diseases.

2880/A0/04/200/205.indicator_name: Percentage of media with editorial standards for reporting on children
2880/A0/04/200/205.headline: UNICEF Mongolia continued to raise the visibility of key issues affecting children in the country through evidence-based  compelling messages and communication products to inspire key audiences and this was particularly evident in the emergence of the child impacts of air pollution.

2880/A0/04/200/205.status_value: Media monitoring report conducted in the second half of 2014 shows the following figures: Newspaper ¿ 4% Online ¿ 12.4% Television ¿ 12.4%

2880/A0/04/200/204.indicator_name: Number of business sectors that adopt policies and practices that respect and support children's rights
2880/A0/04/200/204.headline: UNICEF Mongolia strengthened and widened its networks with the private sector through strategic partnerships  capacity building and technical assistance with champions in key industries (IT  cashmere and mining) for the implementation of the child rights and business principles (CRBP).

2880/A0/05/300/302.indicator_name: Existence of Child Protection costed strategic plan is available
2880/A0/05/300/302.headline: Technical assistance provided to the Government in developing the guidelines  SoPs and standards to enforce the Laws on Child protection and on Combatting Domestic Violence  and in building capacity of social welfare service providers including a national ToT and trainings for 97 multi-disciplinary teams in 5 target areas.

2880/A0/05/300/302.indicator_name: Existence of national routine administrative data collection system on violence  exploitation and abuse of children including violent deaths and injuries
2880/A0/05/300/302.headline: Technical assistance provided to the Government in developing the guidelines  SoPs and standards to enforce the Laws on Child protection and on Combatting Domestic Violence  and in building capacity of social welfare service providers including a national ToT and trainings for 97 multi-disciplinary teams in 5 target areas.

2880/A0/05/300/302.indicator_name: Multidisciplinary teams in selected target areas fully operationalized.

2880/A0/05/300/303.indicator_name: Child Friendly strategies have been introduced and implemented in target areas
2880/A0/05/300/303.headline: The planning and steps for the replication of the Child Friendly Community approach in new geographic areas have been agreed with local governments and commitment to lunch the CFC obtained.

2880/A0/05/300/303.indicator_name: # of meetings/consultations/experience sharing events conducted to develop/launch the CFC strategy at least 2 in one province and one district
2880/A0/05/300/303.headline: The planning and steps for the replication of the Child Friendly Community approach in new geographic areas have been agreed with local governments and commitment to lunch the CFC obtained.

2880/A0/05/300/301.indicator_name: Evidence of use of budget and impact analyses for improved programme design/targeting
2880/A0/05/300/301.headline: Availability of quality evidence and data for social policy with strong focus on equity is strengthened. The PEIR of air pollution and child health and the Real Time Monitoring of Impact of economic hardship on children are ongoing. Preparation of budget brief and launch of GC 19 is on track.

2880/A0/05/300/304.indicator_name: Number of business platforms/associations that become public advocates and champions of children's rights and support UNICEF's key messages
2880/A0/05/300/304.headline: UNICEF Mongolia's strategic engagement with the private sector for the implementation of the child rights and business principles enhanced commitment to CRBP and demonstrated tangible benefits for children through provision of air purifiers in kindergartens and clinics  installation of WASH in kindergarten  ICT for awareness raising and behavior change.

2880/A0/04/300/306.status_value: 65 health professionals trained on Management of Severe and Moderate Acute Malnutrition in focus areas.  IYCF counselling training will start in September. Technical and financial support being provided to newly established Child Nursing Centre in Khuvsgul aimag.
